text: Entrepreneurial Roots Run Deep for Young WV Businessman
label: BODY

text: FAIRMONT - Entrepreneurship is a familiar word to Chirag Patel.  He was just 5 years old when his parents,
label: BODY

text: Pravin and Tara, relocated to West Virginia from New Jersey to open the Heldreth Motel and Restaurant in
label: BODY

text: Kingwood.  That small business venture has expanded to eight motels stretched over three states.  His
label: BODY

text: grandparents operated small businesses in Tanzania (Africa) and the Fiji Islands more than 50 years ago.
label: BODY

text: Growing up the son and grandson of small business owners, and experiencing firsthand the rewards and benefits
label: BODY

text: of small business ownership, Patel was destined to follow the same path.
label: BODY

text: Patel is currently President and Chief Executive Officer of DN American, an information technology company
label: BODY

text: certified in the U.S. Small Business Administration’s 8(a) Business Development and Small Disadvantaged
label: BODY

text: Business programs.  DN American is located at the West Virginia High Technology Park in Fairmont, W.Va.
label: BODY

text: During the short course of his entrepreneurial career, he has managed several small business concerns.  “I
label: BODY

text: actually started my first business, FITNETICS, LLC, a fitness center, soon after I graduated from West Virginia
label: BODY

text: University in 1998,” said Patel.  “I majored in business management and couldn’t wait to graduate and start my
label: BODY

text: own business.”
label: BODY

text: Asked why he chose a fitness center as his first business venture Patel replies, “Fitness had always been a
label: BODY

text: hobby. If I could found the right location, I knew I could start a successful fitness facility. The Morgantown
label: BODY

text: area was saturated with fitness centers at the time and Fairmont seemed like the logical location, especially the
label: BODY

text: area around the I-79 high-tech corridor.”  Soon after opening FITNETICS he met and married his wife, Binita,
label: BODY

text: who joined him in the day-to-day operations of the center.
label: BODY

text: Patel knew about the U.S. Small Business Administration’s 8(a) Business Development Program from his
label: BODY

text: internships during college at DN American, then owned by cousin Nash Patel.  “I saw how the government
label: BODY

text: contracting program helped DN American grow and as a result, I knew that’s where I wanted to go,” added
label: BODY

text: Patel.
label: BODY

text: The SBA is a federal government agency that helps maintain and strengthen the nation’s economy by aiding,
label: BODY

text: counseling, assisting and protecting the interests of small business and by helping families and businesses
label: BODY

text: recover from national disasters.   The 8(a) program is an essential instrument for helping socially and
label: BODY

text: economically disadvantaged entrepreneurs gain access to the economic mainstream of American society. The
label: BODY

text: SBA has helped thousands of aspiring entrepreneurs over the years to gain a foothold in government
label: BODY

text: contracting.  Participation is divided into two phases over nine years: a four-year developmental stage and a
label: BODY

text: five-year transitional stage.
label: BODY

text: Participants can receive sole-source contracts, up to a ceiling of $3 million for goods and services and $5
label: BODY

text: million for manufacturing.  While SBA helps 8(a) firms build their competitive and institutional know-how, the
label: BODY

text: agency also encourages them to participate in competitive acquisitions.
label: BODY

text: After certification in the 8(a) program, Patel turned the operations of FITNETICS over to his wife and
label: BODY

text: concentrated his efforts on a new information technology business, Innovative Management and Technology
label: BODY

text: Systems (IMTS).  “I began marketing IMTS as an IT services company with the assistance from Nash at DN
label: BODY

text: American,” said Patel.  “That eventually led to a formal mentor-protégé agreement through the SBA’s 8(a)
label: BODY

text: program.  The agreement helped my business grow from one employee to 20 over the course of two years and
label: BODY

text: led to two subcontracts through DN American with the Federal Bureau of Investigations and National
label: BODY

text: Aeronautics and Space Administration.”
label: BODY

text: More contracts soon followed, including their first prime contract with NASA’s IV&V facility in Fairmont.
label: BODY

text: “We decided to sell the fitness facility and concentrate our efforts on growing IMTS,” adds Patel.  “SBA’s
label: BODY

text: mentor-protégé program enabled me to grow my company by marketing and providing services to the federal
label: BODY

text: government.”
label: BODY

text: His entrepreneurial efforts drew the attention of Vanessa Schoetz, affiliated services manager at the West
label: BODY

text: Virginia High Technology Foundation, who nominated him as SBA’s 2005 Young Entrepreneur of the Year for
label: BODY

text: West Virginia; he won.  “Receiving the Young Entrepreneur award is a very important milestone in my early
label: BODY

text: career,” Patel said.  “I’m very grateful for the support I’ve received, especially from my colleagues at DN
label: BODY

text: American, the SBA, the WVHTF, and most importantly, my family.”
label: BODY

text: Patel is not slowing down; in fact, he recently acquired DN American. “I will continue to operate under the DN
label: BODY

text: American name,” he said. “I want to build on the successful legacy that has spanned the past 15 years.”
label: BODY

text: That company, which is comprised of 150 employees in six states, continues to grow.  “Our vision is to
label: BODY

text: continue expanding into other regions of the country,” he adds.
label: BODY

text: Although Patel has demonstrated the potential to grow, he does not plan to move the company out of the state.
label: BODY

text: “West Virginia is a great place to live and raise a family,” states Patel.  “We have great employees at DN
label: BODY

text: American. They are supportive, really enjoy their work, and are like family.  I am not even thinking about
label: BODY

text: moving the company, just to grow it.”
label: BODY

text: For more information on the SBA and the resources available to assist small business, contact the West Virginia
label: BODY

text: District Office at 800-767-8052 extension 8 or by email at wvinfo@sba.gov, or visit their web site at
label: BODY

text: www.sba.gov/wv.
label: BODY
